content: To learn more about treatment, including where to find it, visit the National Center for PTSD website
To locate a mental health care provider:
Find Local Care: Locate the Veterans services closest to you.
Behavioral Health Treatment Services Locator (SAHMHSA): Resources and locations for the general public as well as veterans.
or visit the Returning Service Members website to ask for a referral.
Women Veterans can call the Women Veterans Call Center at 1-855-829-6636
Some personnel may also be eligible for services at local Vet Centers.
The American Psychological Association offers an online tool for finding a psychologist in your area.
The American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy also maintains an online tool for finding a marriage or family counselor.
American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy
Psychology Today provides a tool for locating a counselor, support group, or psychiatrist near you.
If you are a family member trying to help a Veteran with PTSD:

Try calling Coaching Into Care at 1-888-823-7458 which is available Monday through Friday, 8am-8pm PST. Talk to a real person who can provide information, encouragement, and expert advice for helping a Veteran get effective treatments for PTSD.
GiveAnHour offers free or low-cost counseling services to military personnel, Veterans, and their family members.
